foods.name: Pizza
foods.description: Pizza is an Italian flatbread typically topped with tomato sauce, cheese and various toppings (meats, vegetables, etc.) and baked at high temperature:contentReference[oaicite:2]{index=2}.
foods.instructions: Prepare and roll dough, spread tomato sauce and cheese on top, add desired toppings, and bake in a hot oven until crust is golden and cheese melted.

foods.name: Pasta Carbonara
foods.description: Pasta Carbonara is an Italian pasta dish made with eggs, cheese (usually Pecorino Romano or Parmesan), cured pork (pancetta or guanciale), and black pepper, creating a creamy sauce.
foods.instructions: Cook pasta until al dente. In a pan, crisp the pancetta. Whisk eggs with cheese and pepper, then combine off-heat with hot pasta and pancetta so the eggs form a sauce. Serve immediately.

foods.name: Risotto
foods.description: Risotto is a creamy Italian rice dish cooked slowly in broth until velvety.  Classic risotto often includes onions, white wine, Parmesan cheese, and butter.
foods.instructions: Sauté onions in butter, add Arborio rice and toast briefly. Deglaze with white wine. Gradually add hot broth, stirring until absorbed and rice is creamy. Finish with Parmesan cheese and butter.

foods.name: Tiramisu
foods.description: Tiramisu is a classic Italian dessert made of coffee-soaked ladyfingers layered with a whipped mixture of eggs, sugar, and mascarpone cheese, then dusted with cocoa powder.
foods.instructions: Dip ladyfinger biscuits quickly in strong coffee and arrange in a dish. Whip egg yolks with sugar, fold in mascarpone and whipped egg whites. Layer this cream over the ladyfingers, then chill. Dust with cocoa before serving.

foods.name: Gelato
foods.description: Gelato is Italian-style ice cream that is denser and creamier than regular ice cream, typically made with milk, sugar, and flavorings (fruit, nut, or chocolate).
foods.instructions: Combine milk, sugar, and desired flavor (e.g. fruit puree or nut paste). Heat and cool the mixture, then churn in an ice-cream maker until thick. Freeze briefly before serving.

foods.name: Lasagna
foods.description: Lasagna is an Italian baked dish with layers of flat pasta sheets, rich meat or tomato sauce, béchamel or cheese, and often ground meat or vegetables.
foods.instructions: Layer cooked lasagna noodles with meat sauce and béchamel (or ricotta), then top with cheese. Repeat layers and bake until bubbling and golden on top.

foods.name: Kung Pao Chicken
foods.description: Kung Pao Chicken is a spicy Sichuan stir-fry dish of diced chicken, peanuts, vegetables and chili peppers in a savory-sweet sauce.
foods.instructions: Marinate chicken cubes in soy and cornstarch. Stir-fry dried chilies and Sichuan peppercorn until fragrant, add chicken and sauce (soy, vinegar, sugar), stir in roasted peanuts, and serve hot.

foods.name: Fried Rice
foods.description: Fried Rice is a Chinese-style stir-fried dish made by cooking rice with soy sauce, eggs, vegetables, and often meat or seafood.
foods.instructions: Cook and cool rice ahead of time. Stir-fry beaten eggs, set aside. In wok, sauté garlic/onion, add veggies and cooked meat, then add rice and soy sauce, mixing well. Stir in scrambled eggs at end.

foods.name: Dumplings
foods.description: Dumplings (e.g. Chinese jiaozi) are dough parcels typically filled with minced meat and/or vegetables, then boiled, steamed or pan-fried.
foods.instructions: Make a dough of flour and water, roll into wrappers. Fill with seasoned minced pork (or other) and vegetable mixture. Seal edges. Boil until they float, or steam/fry until cooked.

foods.name: Peking Duck
foods.description: Peking Duck is a famous Chinese dish of roasted duck known for its crispy skin. Traditionally, the duck is served with thin pancakes, spring onions and hoisin sauce.
foods.instructions: Season and air-dry the duck, then roast until skin is crispy. Carve thin slices. Serve with warm pancakes, sliced scallions, cucumber, and hoisin sauce.

foods.name: Spring Rolls
foods.description: Spring Rolls are crispy Asian appetizers of thin pastry filled with vegetables (and sometimes meat) and deep-fried until golden.
foods.instructions: Prepare filling with shredded vegetables (and cooked meat/shrimp) seasoned with soy and ginger. Roll filling in spring roll wrappers, sealing edges with egg wash. Deep-fry until crispy.

foods.name: Butter Chicken
foods.description: Butter Chicken (Murgh Makhani) is an Indian curry of tandoori-grilled chicken pieces simmered in a creamy spiced tomato sauce.
foods.instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt and spices and bake or grill. Sauté tomatoes, garlic, ginger; add spices and cream. Simmer until sauce thickens, then add chicken pieces and heat through.

foods.name: Biryani
foods.description: Biryani is a fragrant Indian/Persian rice dish layered with spiced meat (chicken, lamb, or vegetables) and cooked together, often garnished with fried onions and herbs.
foods.instructions: Cook rice with whole spices until half done. Sauté onions, ginger-garlic, add meat and biryani spices, cook until tender. Layer meat with par-cooked rice, cover tightly, and steam on low heat.

foods.name: Samosa
foods.description: Samosas are deep-fried South Asian pastries filled with spiced potatoes, peas and sometimes meat. They are triangular and crunchy.
foods.instructions: Prepare a dough of flour and water. Make a filling of boiled potatoes, peas and spices (cumin, coriander). Fill dough pockets with filling, seal, and deep-fry until golden.

foods.name: Tandoori Chicken
foods.description: Tandoori Chicken is an Indian dish where chicken pieces are marinated in yogurt and spices (including tandoori masala and turmeric) and traditionally roasted in a clay oven (tandoor).
foods.instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt mixed with tandoori spices and lemon juice. Let sit for hours. Roast or grill the chicken until cooked, basting with marinade occasionally.

foods.name: Dal Makhani
foods.description: Dal Makhani is a rich Punjabi dish of black lentils and kidney beans simmered with butter and cream, flavored with ginger, garlic and spices.
foods.instructions: Soak black lentils and kidney beans overnight. Pressure-cook with water. In a pan, sauté onions, garlic, ginger, spices and tomato purée. Add cooked lentils, cream and butter, simmer until thick.

foods.name: Tacos
foods.description: Tacos are a traditional Mexican food consisting of small hand-sized corn or flour tortillas topped with filling (meat, beans, vegetables) and garnishes.
foods.instructions: Warm tortillas. Fill with seasoned cooked meat (or beans), then top with chopped onion, cilantro, and a squeeze of lime or salsa.

foods.name: Burrito
foods.description: A Burrito is a Mexican dish where a flour tortilla is wrapped around fillings such as seasoned rice, beans, meat, cheese and salsa.
foods.instructions: Spread rice, beans, cooked meat, cheese and salsa on a warm tortilla. Fold in edges and roll tightly into a cylinder. Serve whole or grilled briefly to seal.

foods.name: Guacamole
foods.description: Guacamole is a Mexican dip made from mashed ripe avocados mixed with lime juice, onion, cilantro, tomatoes and chili peppers.
foods.instructions: Mash ripe avocados in a bowl. Stir in chopped red onion, diced tomatoes, chopped cilantro, lime juice, salt and minced chili pepper. Mix and serve fresh.

foods.name: Enchiladas
foods.description: Enchiladas are Mexican tortillas rolled around a filling (meat, cheese, or beans) and covered with chili pepper sauce and cheese, then baked.
foods.instructions: Dip corn tortillas in enchilada sauce, fill with shredded chicken or cheese, roll up and place in a baking dish. Pour more sauce on top, sprinkle cheese, and bake until bubbly.

foods.name: Salsa
foods.description: Salsa (Pico de Gallo) is a fresh Mexican sauce made from chopped tomatoes, onion, chili peppers, cilantro, and lime juice. It can be cooked or fresh.
foods.instructions: Combine diced tomatoes, onion, jalapeño, chopped cilantro, lime juice and salt in a bowl. Toss together and let sit briefly for flavors to meld. Serve chilled or room temperature.

foods.name: Sushi
foods.description: Sushi is a Japanese dish of vinegared rice, often topped or rolled with raw fish, vegetables, and sometimes seaweed.
foods.instructions: Cook sushi rice and season with vinegar. Place seaweed on mat, add rice and fillings (raw fish or vegetables), roll tightly, and slice into pieces. Serve with soy sauce, wasabi and pickled ginger.

foods.name: Ramen
foods.description: Ramen is a Japanese noodle soup with Chinese-style wheat noodles in a meat or fish broth, often flavored with soy or miso, and topped with meat, egg, and vegetables.
foods.instructions: Simmer broth with soy sauce, miso or seasoning. Cook ramen noodles separately. In a bowl, add noodles, pour hot broth over, then top with sliced pork, boiled egg, seaweed, and green onions.

foods.name: Tempura
foods.description: Tempura is a Japanese dish of seafood or vegetables dipped in a light batter and deep-fried until crispy.
foods.instructions: Prepare batter of cold water and flour. Dip shrimp or vegetable pieces in batter, then deep-fry in hot oil until crispy and light golden. Serve immediately with dipping sauce.
ingredients: shrimp or vegetables (e.g. sweet potato, zucchini)

foods.name: Miso Soup
foods.description: Miso Soup is a traditional Japanese soup made from dashi stock and miso paste, often containing tofu, seaweed and green onions.
foods.instructions: Heat dashi broth, add softened miso paste. Mix until dissolved. Add cubed tofu and wakame seaweed, simmer briefly. Serve hot garnished with chopped green onion.

foods.name: Okonomiyaki
foods.description: Okonomiyaki is a Japanese savory pancake containing batter, cabbage, and often pork or seafood, topped with okonomiyaki sauce, mayo, and bonito flakes.
foods.instructions: Mix flour, egg, dashi (broth) and shredded cabbage into a batter. Fry a portion on a griddle, adding sliced pork belly on top. Flip to cook through. Spread with okonomiyaki sauce and mayo.

foods.name: Croissant
foods.description: A croissant is a flaky French pastry made from layered yeast-leavened dough with butter, shaped like a crescent.
foods.instructions: Make a dough, layer with butter by folding and rolling (lamination). Cut into triangles, roll into crescents, let rise, then bake until golden brown.

foods.name: Coq au Vin
foods.description: Coq au Vin is a classic French stew of chicken braised with wine (typically Burgundy), lardons, mushrooms and onions.
foods.instructions: Brown chicken with bacon lardons. Remove and sauté onions and mushrooms in the same pan. Return chicken, add garlic and herbs, pour wine and broth, simmer for 1-2 hours until tender.

foods.name: Ratatouille
foods.description: Ratatouille is a French Provençal vegetable stew made from tomatoes, eggplant, zucchini, bell peppers, onions, and herbs.
foods.instructions: Sauté onions and garlic in olive oil, add diced eggplant and zucchini, cook until softened. Stir in tomatoes and bell peppers, season with herbs (thyme, basil), simmer until vegetables are tender.

foods.name: Crepes
foods.description: Crêpes are thin French pancakes made from a simple batter of flour, milk, and eggs, often filled with sweet or savory fillings.
foods.instructions: Whisk together flour, milk, and eggs to make a thin batter. Heat a non-stick pan, pour a small amount of batter and tilt to coat. Cook until set and lightly browned, then flip. Fill or top as desired.

foods.name: Moussaka
foods.description: Moussaka is a Greek casserole dish with layers of eggplant, ground meat (typically lamb or beef), and béchamel sauce on top.
foods.instructions: Layer sliced and fried eggplant in a dish, then add cooked spiced ground lamb tomato sauce. Top with béchamel sauce. Bake until golden and bubbly.

foods.name: Gyros
foods.description: Gyros are Greek sandwiches of meat (often lamb or chicken) cooked on a vertical rotisserie, served wrapped in a pita with tomatoes, onion, and tzatziki sauce.
foods.instructions: Season and stack sliced meat on a vertical rotisserie (or grill). Carve thin as it cooks. Serve in a warm pita bread with chopped tomato, onion, and tzatziki.

foods.name: Tzatziki
foods.description: Tzatziki is a Greek yogurt-based sauce or dip made with cucumber, garlic, lemon juice and dill or mint.
foods.instructions: Grate cucumber and squeeze out excess water. Mix thick yogurt with grated cucumber, minced garlic, lemon juice, olive oil and chopped dill or mint. Chill before serving.

foods.name: Hummus
foods.description: Hummus is a Middle Eastern spread made from cooked, mashed chickpeas blended with tahini, lemon juice, garlic and olive oil.
foods.instructions: Blend cooked chickpeas, tahini, lemon juice, garlic, and olive oil in a food processor until smooth. Add salt to taste. Drizzle with olive oil and paprika to serve.

foods.name: Falafel
foods.description: Falafel are deep-fried balls or patties made from ground chickpeas (or fava beans) mixed with herbs and spices, popular in Middle Eastern cuisine.
foods.instructions: Soak dried chickpeas and grind with onion, garlic, parsley, cumin and coriander. Form into balls or patties and deep-fry until crispy and golden.

foods.name: Shawarma
foods.description: Shawarma is a Middle Eastern wrap of spiced meat (often chicken, lamb or beef) that is slow-cooked on a vertical spit, shaved off, and served in pita or flatbread with salad and sauces.
foods.instructions: Marinate and roast meat on a spit or grill. Slice thinly. Serve wrapped in pita with toppings like lettuce, tomato, pickles, and garlic or tahini sauce.

foods.name: Pad Thai
foods.description: Pad Thai is a Thai stir-fried noodle dish with rice noodles, eggs, tofu or shrimp, bean sprouts and peanuts in a sweet-sour tamarind sauce.
foods.instructions: Stir-fry soaked rice noodles with garlic, tofu or shrimp, and scrambled eggs. Add a sauce made from tamarind paste, fish sauce, sugar. Toss with bean sprouts, serve topped with crushed peanuts.

foods.name: Pho
foods.description: Pho is a Vietnamese soup consisting of broth, rice noodles, herbs, and meat (usually beef or chicken).
foods.instructions: Simmer beef bones or chicken with spices (star anise, cinnamon, ginger) to make a broth. Cook rice noodles. In a bowl, add noodles, pour hot broth over with thinly sliced beef or chicken, and garnish with fresh herbs, bean sprouts and lime.

foods.name: Nasi Goreng
foods.description: Nasi Goreng is an Indonesian fried rice dish flavored with sweet soy sauce (kecap manis), shrimp paste and spices, often topped with a fried egg.
foods.instructions: Stir-fry cooked rice with garlic, shallot, chili, shrimp paste and kecap manis (sweet soy). Add vegetables and meat if desired. Top with a fried egg before serving.

foods.name: Cheeseburger
foods.description: A Cheeseburger is an American sandwich consisting of a ground beef patty topped with cheese and served in a bun, often with lettuce, tomato and condiments.
foods.instructions: Grill or pan-fry a seasoned beef patty. Place patty on a toasted bun, add a slice of cheddar (or American) cheese, lettuce, tomato, onion and ketchup or mustard as desired.

foods.name: BBQ Ribs
foods.description: BBQ Ribs are pork ribs slow-cooked or grilled and brushed with barbecue sauce, a staple of American barbecue cuisine.
foods.instructions: Season pork ribs with rub and smoke or slow-cook until tender. Brush with barbecue sauce and grill briefly to caramelize glaze. Serve with extra sauce.

foods.name: Mac and Cheese
foods.description: Macaroni and Cheese is an American comfort food of elbow macaroni pasta baked in a creamy cheese sauce.
foods.instructions: Cook macaroni. Make a cheese sauce by melting butter, whisking in flour, then adding milk and shredded cheese. Combine sauce with macaroni, sprinkle breadcrumbs and cheese on top, bake until bubbly.

foods.name: Pancakes
foods.description: American pancakes are fluffy round cakes made from a batter of flour, eggs, milk and baking powder, typically served stacked with syrup.
foods.instructions: Whisk flour, milk, eggs and baking powder to make a batter. Pour onto a hot griddle, cook until bubbles form, flip and cook until golden. Serve with maple syrup and butter.

foods.name: Ceviche
foods.description: Ceviche is a Latin American dish (Peruvian origin) of raw fish (or seafood) cured in citrus juices (like lime), mixed with onions, chili peppers and cilantro.
foods.instructions: Dice fresh fish. Marinate in lime juice for 10–15 minutes until opaque. Drain some liquid, toss with sliced red onion, chopped chili, cilantro, and season with salt.

foods.name: Arepas
foods.description: Arepas are Venezuelan/Colombian cornmeal flatbreads, grilled or fried and often stuffed or topped with cheese, meat or avocado.
foods.instructions: Mix pre-cooked cornmeal with water and salt to form a dough. Shape into patties and grill or fry until golden. Split and fill with cheese, beans, or shredded meat if desired.

foods.name: Empanadas
foods.description: Empanadas are Latin American pastries made by folding dough around a savory filling (meat, cheese, or vegetables) and baking or frying.
foods.instructions: Prepare dough from flour, fat and water. Make a filling of seasoned ground meat (or cheese). Fill dough circles, fold into half-moons and seal edges. Bake or deep-fry until golden.

foods.name: Feijoada
foods.description: Feijoada is a Brazilian stew of black beans with pork (sausage, bacon, ribs) and beef, slow-cooked and often served with rice and orange slices.
foods.instructions: Soak black beans. Brown assorted pork cuts and sausage, then add beans and water or broth. Simmer slowly until meat is tender and stew thick. Serve with white rice and orange wedges.

foods.name: Jollof Rice
foods.description: Jollof Rice is a West African one-pot rice dish cooked in a tomato-based sauce with spices, often served with fried plantains or meat.
foods.instructions: Blend tomatoes, peppers and onions, cook to form a base. Add spices (thyme, curry, chili), then add rice and water or broth. Cover and simmer until rice is done, stirring occasionally.

foods.name: Bobotie
foods.description: Bobotie is a South African baked dish of spiced minced meat (often beef or lamb) topped with an egg-based custard.
foods.instructions: Sauté minced meat with onions, curry powder, fruit (raisin or apricot) and vinegar. Place in a baking dish. Pour beaten egg and milk mixture on top and bake until set.

foods.name: Tagine
foods.description: Tagine is a North African (Moroccan) slow-cooked stew named after the clay pot it’s cooked in, often made with lamb or chicken, vegetables, and spices like cumin and cinnamon.
foods.instructions: Brown meat with onions in the tagine pot, add spices (cumin, ginger, cinnamon), then add chopped vegetables and water. Cover and cook over low heat until meat is tender and sauce is rich.
